p: Over the last century, WEEV enzootic activity and WEE cases have significantly declined. WEEV has not been detected among its natural enzootic host and vector species since a house sparrow tested seropositive in Harris County, Texas, in 2015 [ 170] and a mosquito pool confirmed PCR-positive in Clark County, Nevada in 2013 [ 171]. Furthermore, a recent study tested a large number of Cx. tarsalis mosquito pools from Larimer County, Colorado, and found no evidence of WEEV [ 172]. The specific reason WEEV has apparently ceased its enzootic transmission and disease is something of a mystery, though reduction in incidence does correlate with a drastic decline in the US horse population and increased vaccination coverage of horses [ 139].
